title: Michael Strahan's ex-wife claims GMA host owes nearly $500K in back child support for their twins
text:
Michael Strahan's ex-wife Jean Muggli claimed the former professional football player owes nearly $500,000 in back child support for their twin daughters.

Muggli filed legal documents claiming her ex isn't 'holding up his end' of the deal they struck years ago after divorcing in 2006.

She was initially awarded $15.3million in the divorce and an additional $18,000 per month in support, but Strahan has missed covering half the costs of the girls' horseback riding lessons in addition to adjusted cost of living payments.

That's a lot of cash: Michael Strahan's ex-wife Jean Muggli claimed the former professional football player owes nearly $500,000 in back child support for their twin daughters; seen with Isabella and Sophia in July

Jean claims that the former couple orchestrated a deal where they would evenly split the cost of the girls' equestrian endeavors, which come to a staggering $450,802 total since 2017.

In documents, Strahan claimed no such deal was ever arranged as he fights back against paying roughly $225,000 for their lessons.

Muggli is also seeking $321,654 in back support for cost of living increases since 2010.

Not great: Muggli filed legal documents claiming her ex isn't 'holding up his end' of the deal they struck years ago after divorcing in 2006; seen in 2003

While Michael admitted that cost-of-living adjustments are necessary, he added that the number is 'vague and indefinite.'

The former duo appeared in court last month in attempts to resolve the lengthy custody battle.

The former NFL pro, 47, shares twin daughters with Jean, who were just 20 months old when the couple ended things in 2006.

In the past: The former NFL pro, 47, shares twin daughters with Jean, who were just 20 months old when the couple ended things in 2006; seen in 2004

Muggli is asking the Manhattan Supreme Court to enforce the child support payments agreed to and also order Strahan to contribute to their daughters's horse riding lessons, PageSix.com reported.

A source close to Strahan said the accusations against the TV personality 'are completely false.'

'Michael has always honored his commitments regarding his children,' the insider said. 'The reason they are in court is that Jean continuously asks for more money. Michael intends to do what is best for his children, as he always does. He is properly handling this in the court.'
